content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r" \t+") # Split text into words using regex for whitespaces
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(word) + length(current_line) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * " "
    end

    if length(current_line) > 0
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example:
wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog")
# Output: "The quick brown fox\njumps over\nthe lazy dog"
```
